member.name: M:Unigine.GeodeticsTransformer.get
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the existing geodetics instance.
member.returns: Pointer to the existing geodetics transformer instance. If GeodeticsPlugin is not launched, nullptr is returned.

member.name: M:Unigine.GeodeticsTransformer.geodeticToWorld(Unigine.dvec3,bool) const
member.summary: Transforms geodetic coordinates of the selected coordinate system to the 3D world coordinates: position and rotation (the Y axis is directed to the North, the X axis — to the East, and the Z axis — upwards).
member.param: true to rotate data as follows: East => X, North => Y (ENU and similar systems); false if the data source uses another alignment (for example NED).

member.name: M:Unigine.GeodeticsTransformer.geodeticToWorldPosition(Unigine.dvec3,bool)
member.summary: Transforms geodetic coordinates of the selected coordinate system to the 3D world coordinates (position).
member.param: true to rotate data as follows: East => X, North => Y (ENU and similar systems); false if the data source uses another alignment (for example NED).

member.name: M:Unigine.GeodeticsTransformer.worldToGeodetic(Unigine.dvec3,bool)
member.summary: Transforms the 3D world coordinates to geodetic coordinates of the selected coordinate system.
member.param: true to rotate data as follows: East => X, North => Y (ENU and similar systems); false if the data source uses another alignment (for example NED).

member.name: M:Unigine.GeodeticsTransformer.setProjectionWkt(char,Unigine.dvec3,char,int)
member.summary: Sets a projection by WKT description, which is used as the world coordinate projection, and defines a geodetic coordinate system.
member.param: Description of the projection in the OpenGIS WKT format.
Description of a geodetic coordinate system.

1 or 0.If set to 1, a well-known coordinate system description is used as the geodetic_cs_string argument.The following well-known text values are supported:WGS84 — same as EPSG:4326, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.WGS72 — same as EPSG:4322, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.NAD27 — same as EPSG:4267, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.NAD83 — same as EPSG:4269, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.EPSG:n — n is a GCS code from the horizontal coordinate system table.If set to 0, a detailed WKT description is used.

member.name: M:Unigine.GeodeticsTransformer.setProjectionEpsg(int,Unigine.dvec3,char,int)
member.summary: Sets a projection by EPSG code, which is used as the world coordinate projection, and defines a geodetic coordinate system.
member.param: Description of a geodetic coordinate system.

1 or 0.If set to 1, a well-known coordinate system description is used as the geodetic_cs_string argument.The following well-known text values are supported:WGS84 — same as EPSG:4326, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.WGS72 — same as EPSG:4322, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.NAD27 — same as EPSG:4267, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.NAD83 — same as EPSG:4269, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.EPSG:n — n is a GCS code from the horizontal coordinate system table.If set to 0, a detailed WKT description is used.
